title: Understanding the Common Ion Effect
text: The presence of a common ion in a solution can affect the solubility of a sparingly soluble salt. In this case, the common ion is Cl- from NaCl. How do you think this will affect the solubility of PbCl2?

title: Setting Up the Equilibrium Expression
text: The solubility product expression for PbCl2 is Ksp ext{=}Pb**{2+}*Cl**{-}**2. How can you express the concentrations of these ions in terms of the solubility of PbCl2?

title: Considering the Initial Concentration of Cl-
text: Since NaCl is a strong electrolyte, it completely dissociates in solution. What is the initial concentration of Cl- from NaCl?

title: Solving for Molar Solubility
text: Given that the concentration of Cl- from NaCl is $$0.10$$ M, and the solubility of PbCl2 is s, write the expression for the total concentration of Cl- in the solution.

title: Substituting into the Ksp Expression
text: Substitute the expressions for Pb**{2+} and Cl**{-} into the Ksp expression: Ksp ext{=}Pb**{2+}*Cl**{-}**2. Solve for s.

title: Approximating the Solution
text: Since $$0.10$$ is much larger than 2s, you can approximate $$0.1+2s$$ as $$0.10$$. Solve for s using this approximation.

title: Final Calculation
text: Using the approximation, solve for s in the equation $$1.6e-5$$ ext{=}s*0.10**2.
